files.description: Package initializer exposing the public API for continuum-recovery diagnostics and cross-validation utilities.
Defines a prioritized catalog of candidate continuum observables, scaling quantities, and comparable metrics with schemas and computable estimators.
Implements scaling analysis utilities (effective exponents, finite-size scaling collapses, hyperscaling checks, and error propagation/bootstraps).
Provides mutually comparable distance/consistency metrics for RG flows and semiclassical benchmarks (e.g., Wasserstein/JS on distributions, KL surrogates, and curve/trajectory distances).
Implements lightweight loaders/adapters for tensor-network/lattice RG outputs and GFT/spinfoam coarse-graining logs into a unified in-memory dataset format.
Defines benchmark problem templates and reference comparisons (toy models, known critical points, semiclassical Regge-like limits) with standardized evaluation protocols.
Generates reproducible reports (tables/JSON/plots) summarizing prioritized diagnostics, scaling fits, cross-validation scores, and benchmark comparisons.
Command-line entry point to run the conceptual design workflow: build observable list, ingest example RG data, compute diagnostics, and emit prioritized outputs and benchmark summaries.
Project documentation describing the conceptual design goals, prioritized observable/metric list, data format expectations, and how to run the numerical prototype.
Python project configuration defining package metadata, dependencies, and console script entry point.

missionDescription: Perform a focused conceptual design and specification for continuum-recovery diagnostics and cross-validation tests for spin-foam/GFT renormalization. Produce a prioritized list of candidate continuum observables, scaling quantities, and mutually comparable metrics (suitable for tensor-network/lattice RG and semiclassical checks), together with a short plan for numerical implementation and benchmark comparisons.
missionSuccessCriteria: A compact list (6–10) of candidate continuum observables and scaling quantities (e.g., correlation lengths, spectral dimension, n-point graviton-like correlators, coarse-grained vertex/edge amplitude scaling) with precise definitions that can be computed in spin-foam, GFT, and tensor-network RG settings.

Three concrete, cross-validation test protocols that map how to compare results between (a) tensor-network/lattice RG coarse-graining, (b) spin-foam coarse-graining flows (e.g., amplitude renormalization), and (c) semiclassical/perturbative expansions — each protocol should specify inputs, outputs, and expected GR-like signatures.

A prioritized list of 4–6 diagnostic benchmarks (including scaling exponents, symmetry-restoration measures for diffeomorphism-like moves, and finite-size scaling recipes) with clear pass/fail or scoring criteria for assessing whether a candidate fixed point yields GR-like dynamics.

A concise implementation roadmap (6–10 bullet steps) for open-source numerical toolchains and reproducible benchmarks (required data formats, minimal software stack, example test cases) enabling a follow-up code-creation agent to start immediately.
